TAM.description_of_public: The total addressable market includes all potential motorcycle accessories users globally, encompassing both end customers who own motorcycles and dealers selling these accessories.
TAM.justification: The TAM is derived from market reports indicating there are approximately 15 million motorcycle owners in the EU and US markets alone, with an annual growth rate of 5% due to increasing motorcycle sales and rising interest in motorcycle customization. The growth is based on industry trends where motorcycle ownership is expected to rise as urban mobility solutions evolve. Reports from Statista and IBISWorld support these estimates with projected growth in the motorcycle accessories market.

industry_example.name: Harley-Davidson
industry_example.description: Harley-Davidson operates in the motorcycle accessories market, providing a wide range of products for customization, which illustrates the potential market for accessory bundles.

SAM.description_of_public: The serviceable available market targets motorcycle owners and dealers who are specifically interested in BMW motorcycle accessories and can access the bundles offered through the NBC.
SAM.justification: SAM is estimated to be about 60% of TAM, as BMW targets a specific segment of motorcycle owners and dealers. Market research shows that BMW motorcycles account for approximately 6% of the total motorcycle market, indicating a smaller yet significant segment focused on premium accessories. The growth rate reflects the increasing popularity of BMW motorcycles and their corresponding accessory needs.

industry_example.name: Ducati
industry_example.description: Ducati has successfully established a strong market for its accessories, focusing on their specific customer base, demonstrating how a premium motorcycle brand can capture a substantial share of the accessory market.

SOM.description_of_public: The serviceable obtainable market consists of the percentage of the SAM that can be realistically captured in the short term, focusing on early adopters and dealers willing to streamline their accessory procurement through the new bundles.
SOM.justification: SOM is calculated as approximately 20% of SAM for the first year, increasing due to the anticipated adoption of the NBC system and its convenience. Assumptions are based on early adoption rates seen in similar product launches within the motorcycle industry, where streamlined purchasing processes lead to quicker dealer acceptance and increased sales.

industry_example.name: BMW Motorrad
industry_example.description: BMW Motorrad has successfully implemented programs that improve dealer sales through streamlined processes, capturing significant market share within their segment.
